member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.AzureBlobStorage
member.summary: Implements using Azure Blob Storage.
member.remarks: This class uses a single Azure Storage Blob Container. Each entity or is serialized into a JSON string and stored in an individual text blob. Each blob is named after the store item key, which is encoded so that it conforms a valid blob name. If an entity is an , the storage object will set the entity's property value to the blob's ETag upon read. Afterward, an with the ETag value will be generated during Write. New entities start with a null ETag.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.AzureBlobStorage.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.CloudStorageAccount,System.String,Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Azure CloudStorageAccount instance.
Name of the Blob container where entities will be stored.

If passing in a custom JsonSerializer, we recommend the following settings:
jsonSerializer.TypeNameHandling = TypeNameHandling.All.
jsonSerializer.NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Include.
jsonSerializer.ContractResolver = new DefaultContractResolver().

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Azure Storage connection string.
Name of the Blob container where entities will be stored.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.AzureBlobTranscriptStore
member.summary: The blob transcript store stores transcripts in an Azure Blob container.
member.remarks: Each activity is stored as json blob in structure of container/{channelId]/{conversationId}/{Timestamp.ticks}-{activity.id}.json.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbKeyEscape
member.summary: Helper methods for escaping keys used for Cosmos DB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbKeyEscape.MaxKeyLength
member.summary: Older libraries had a max key length of 255. The limit is now 1023. In this library, 255 remains the default for backwards compat. To override this behavior, and use the longer limit, set CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.CompatibilityMode to false. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/concepts-limits#per-item-limits.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbKeyEscape.EscapeKey(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the key into a DocumentID that can be used safely with Cosmos DB. The following characters are restricted and cannot be used in the Id property: '/', '\', '?', and '#'. More information at .
member.param: The key to escape.
member.returns: An escaped key that can be used safely with CosmosDB.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbKeyEscape.EscapeKey(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the key into a DocumentID that can be used safely with Cosmos DB. The following characters are restricted and cannot be used in the Id property: '/', '\', '?', and '#'. More information at .
member.param: The key to escape.
The string to add at the end of all row keys.
True if running in compatability mode and keys should be truncated in order to support previous CosmosDb max key length of 255. This behavior can be overridden by setting to false.
member.returns: An escaped key that can be used safely with CosmosDB.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorage
member.summary: Implements an CosmosDB based storage provider using partitioning for a bot.

member.param: Cosmos DB partitioned storage configuration options.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. using the provided CosmosDB credentials, database ID, and collection ID.
member.param: Cosmos DB partitioned storage configuration options.

If passing in a custom JsonSerializer, we recommend the following settings:
jsonSerializer.TypeNameHandling = TypeNameHandling.All.
jsonSerializer.NullValueHandling = NullValueHandling.Include.
jsonSerializer.ContractResolver = new DefaultContractResolver().

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorage.ReadAsync(System.String[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reads one or more items with matching keys from the Cosmos DB container.
member.param: A collection of Ids for each item to be retrieved.
The .
member.returns: A dictionary containing the retrieved items.
member.exception: Exception thrown if the array of keys (Ids for the items to be retrieved) is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorage.WriteAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Inserts or updates one or more items into the Cosmos DB container.
member.param: A dictionary of items to be inserted or updated. The dictionary item key is used as the ID for the inserted / updated item.
A .
member.returns: A Task representing the work to be executed.
member.exception: Exception thrown if the changes dictionary is null.
Exception thrown is the etag is empty on any of the items within the changes dictionary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorage.DeleteAsync(System.String[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes one or more items from the Cosmos DB container.
member.param: An array of Ids for the items to be deleted.
A .
member.returns: A Task representing the work to be executed.
member.exception: Thrown if the array of Ids to be deleted is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorage.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object instance and releases any related objects owned by the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorage.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes objects used by the class.
member.param: A Boolean that indicates whether the method call comes from a Dispose method (its value is true) or from a finalizer (its value is false).
member.remarks: The disposing parameter should be false when called from a finalizer, and true when called from the IDisposable.Dispose method. In other words, it is true when deterministically called and false when non-deterministically called.

member.summary: Cosmos DB Partitioned Storage Options.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.CosmosDbEndpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the CosmosDB endpoint.
member.value: The CosmosDB endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.AuthKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication key for Cosmos DB.
member.value: The authentication key for Cosmos DB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.DatabaseId
member.summary: Gets or sets the database identifier for Cosmos DB instance.
member.value: The database identifier for Cosmos DB instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.ContainerId
member.summary: Gets or sets the container identifier.
member.value: The container identifier.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.CosmosClientOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for the CosmosClient.
member.value: The options for use with the CosmosClient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.ContainerThroughput
member.summary: Gets or sets the throughput set when creating the Container. Defaults to 400.
member.value: Container throughput. Defaults to 400.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.KeySuffix
member.summary:
Gets or sets the suffix to be added to every key. .
Note: must be set to 'false' to use a KeySuffix. When KeySuffix is used, keys will NOT be truncated but an exception will be thrown if the key length is longer than allowed by CosmosDb.
member.value: String containing only valid CosmosDb key characters. (e.g. not: '\\', '?', '/', '#', '*').

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Azure.CosmosDbPartitionedStorageOptions.CompatibilityMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to run in Compatibility Mode. Early versions of CosmosDb had a key length limit of 255. Keys longer than this were truncated in . This remains the default behavior, but can be overridden by setting CompatibilityMode to false. This setting will also allow for using older collections where no PartitionKey was specified.
Note: CompatibilityMode cannot be 'true' if KeySuffix is used.
member.value: Currently, max key length for cosmosdb is 1023: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cosmos-db/concepts-limits#per-item-limits The default for backwards compatibility is 255 .

Custom client configuration options.
